page.title: 09LANDSCAPE
page.content: Durness is surrounded by moorland, mountains and sea cliffs. There are many beaches in Durness most of which are sandy. Durness sits on limestone rock which gives unusually fertile soil for the Highlands. There are no rivers in Durness, just two burns, Sango burn and Allt Smoo which flows into Smoo Cave before reaching the sea at Geodha Smoo. The cave is made up from three caverns,the outer one being immense.To get into the others a boat is needed.There is a hole in the roof of the outer cave.The narrow inlet leading to the cave provided a sheltered harbour for fishermen.A ruined store house and a rusty winch is all that remains of this activity. There are a few other smaller caves in the vicinity as well as at Sangobeg sands.
